The first is what I imagine Eve looking like once they get the clouds in. The rest are what I imagine the ringed moon looking like in the next planet additions.

-iBotz

Edited September 3, 2012 by iBotz
Awesome renderings!
Thanks! I plan on doing a flyby of the Kerbol System once I can make high res Kerbin Maps.
They are awesome, especially the last one.

What program is that you're using?

I like them a lot!

What program is that you're using?

I like them a lot!

Thanks! I use a program called modo 601 by Luxology. All of the planets are generated procedurally, so I can make hundreds of different variations. That last image took about 2 hours to render on my 16 core machine!
Nice! I only have two cores on my ThinkPad

Awesome renderings!

What he/she said

Awesome rendering!

Amazing, they look awesome

By the way, im still a major newbie, but how did you get so many planets?

As far as ive seen in the game its Kerbin, the Mun and Minmus.

Is it a mod?
Deel its a render, from another software, not from ksp

Edited September 16, 2012 by iBotz

Amazing, they look awesome

By the way, im still a major newbie, but how did you get so many planets?

As far as ive seen in the game its Kerbin, the Mun and Minmus.

Is it a mod?

These planets will be implemented in the next update, Deel.
is your computer up to rendering a 1080p image? They'll make a great wallpaper

is your computer up to rendering a 1080p image? They'll make a great wallpaper

I could render a 5K image if I choose to, so a 1920x1080 is nothing. Tell me which one you like and when I have a moment, I'll pop it up with a Duna attempt maybe
The 2nd image from the first set you posted up, the planet with rings closer view and heck i'd love to see a 5k pic too
what texture did you use for the rings ?

what texture did you use for the rings ?

In the program I use, modo 601, there is a massive library of noise presets. I used one that created black and white bands, and made loop around on itself. I then adjusted the colors.If you look in the image i posted showing the "behind the scenes" specifically on the list to the right, you can see a material called rings and all of the noise patterns that compose it.

Edited September 17, 2012 by iBotz
More info

So, I decided to create an 8k image (7680x4320) (10mb).

https://www.dropbox.com/s/la1ob3wak4fcdsb/Untitled.JPG

that took about an hour to render, so a 1920x1080 should be minutes. Ill try and have that up tonight.

Thanks! I use a program called modo 601 by Luxology. All of the planets are generated procedurally, so I can make hundreds of different variations. That last image took about 2 hours to render on my 16 core machine!

HOLY TOLEDO! The price of that machine must be astronomical! What career needs that awesome machine?!?!

-Posted from my I7
